should move over to Africa, and there' a group of doctors in Europe that want to introduce lower cost in-vitro in Africa.

One is, the rising power of women in Africa who are demanding changes in health care, and also demanding changes that are to their benefit.

I think that you can look at many countries in Africa and see the emergence of women's movements that are very significant.

The issue that I would pose is the need to link this with the comprehensive issue of health care on the continent.
When you're talking about anything related to childbirth and sex you have to talk about sex, which means that you also have to talk about STDs, HIV/AIDS.
